name: DNSExfiltration (doh)
description:
DNSExfiltrator allows for transferring (exfiltrate) a file over a DNS request covert channel. This is basically a data leak testing tool allowing to exfiltrate data over a covert channel.
!!! Test will fail without a domain under your control with A record and NS record !!! 
See this github page for more details - https://github.com/Arno0x/DNSExfiltrator

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: DNSExfiltrator powershell file must exist on disk at specified location (#{ps_module})

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: DNSExfiltrator powershell file must exist on disk at specified location (#{ps_module})

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/1
steps.description: DNSExfiltrator powershell file must exist on disk at specified location (#{ps_module})

input_arguments.name: password
input_arguments.description: Password used to encrypt the data to be exfiltrated

input_arguments.name: domain
input_arguments.description: The domain name to use for DNS requests

input_arguments.name: doh
input_arguments.description: Google or CloudFlare DoH (DNS over HTTP) server

input_arguments.name: time
input_arguments.description: The time in milliseconds to wait between each DNS request

input_arguments.name: encoding
input_arguments.description: Set to '-b32' to use base32 encoding of data. Might be required by some DNS resolvers.
